meanings.definition: In a manner that is extremely frugal or stingy with money.
meanings.sent1: She lived penuriously, always saving every penny she earned.
meanings.sent2: He managed his finances penuriously, never splurging on unnecessary items.
meanings.sent3: The millionaire decided to live penuriously for a month as a social experiment.
meanings.sent4: Her grip on the purse strings was so penuriously tight, even a dollar seemed too much.
meanings.sent5: The image of Scrooge counting his coins penuriously is etched in our minds.

meanings.definition: Showing great reluctance to spend money.
meanings.sent1: The penuriously wealthy man refused to upgrade his old car despite its constant breakdowns.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her penuriously cautious approach to shopping, always looking for the best deals.
meanings.sent3: The penuriously frugal cat refused to play with any toy that required spending money.
meanings.sent4: His penuriously tight grip on the wallet made him the least popular person to go out with.
meanings.sent5: The penuriously hesitant bride took months to decide on a budget for the wedding.
